column1: A happy and safe Thanksgiving to all. I know it’s hard to be away from loved ones during the pandemic especially this time of year. Thank you for all you’re doing to protect yourself and others. https://t.co/3FoZwg7gno

Our economy faces many challenges and few people are more suited to meet those challenges as our new Treasury Secretary than Janet Yellen. She has faced big problems in the past and she has faced them head on. https://t.co/SUS1ZUEjxl

Check out the latest legislative update in my E-Newsletter! Details on my bill to expand apprenticeships negotiations on coronavirus relief protecting our oceans and more are inside. https://t.co/2xYGOKZmDg
It's time to end this policy once and for all. It's base solely on discrimination. Transgender Americans have been serving their country with courage and distinction. https://t.co/8SZ6rbOyv1

President-elect Biden’s cabinet picks reflect the best and brightest experts in their fields but also look like America. The American people will be well-served by them and they will inspire future generations. https://t.co/Sc5o99VVvb

The House passed my bill to expand apprenticeships. With more clearly established programs families can sit at the kitchen table and look to a rejuvenated Registered Apprenticeship system as one of many high quality pathways to a post-secondary education. https://t.co/k1tOOKfi59 https://t.co/NWEel5CgLT

House is debating my bill to renew the National Apprenticeship Act to create nearly one million new apprenticeships. As many workers have been forced to look for new pathways to financial stability we have a responsibility to expand employment opportunities. https://t.co/F7ZeHzBt56

It's #TransgenderAwarenessWeek! The past four years put transgender Americans in the spotlight as the Trump administration attacked their right to basic legal protections. This week we celebrate the transgender community and keep working to protect and expand their rights. https://t.co/1MguiIX60o

We salute our veterans for their sacrifice & that of their family. Thank you to the men & women who served for developing what it takes to be strong & knowledgeable in your field of expertise. We know freedoms don’t come easy. Your dedication represents your commitment to us. https://t.co/DbH8SzISFS

Over 130M Americans live with pre-existing conditions. They rely on the Affordable Care Act’s pre-existing condition protections to receive healthcare. President Trump the GOP are continuing their attacks on the ACA today at the Supreme Court. #SaveTheACA! https://t.co/KsJfQLzggV

Congratulations President-elect Joe Biden Dr. Jill Biden Vice-President-elect Kamala Harris and Doug Emhoff!! I could not be more overjoyed for what they will bring to every American in making our country the best it can be! https://t.co/wFIzZVXyIm
The Department of Justice is not the President's personal law firm. https://t.co/fisM9PTL91

Meanwhile bills passed by the House to provide economic relief to the American people collect dust on Leader McConnell's desk. The Senate has time to rush through a Supreme Court nominee but no time to help struggling Americans. https://t.co/wJi8RnZ1QY

Senate GOP ignored the will of the American people & rushed this nominee through with the goal of stripping healthcare coverage from millions. This is a threat to those with pre-existing conditions a woman's right to choose LGBTQ rights and much more. https://t.co/VMEtnNq3vU

My bipartisan bill to end military hunger passed the House in the National Defense Authorization Act. As we begin final negotiations on the NDAA I appreciate the efforts of groups to ensure my bill gets enacted. It's time we finally address this issue. https://t.co/cYwm1hYRFM

Proud to receive the Lifetime Friend of CalRTA Award from the California Retired Teachers Association today.  It has been my honor to stand up for public schools and our tireless educators who are so deserving of our thanks and support. https://t.co/Sj5Bk4jpAD

Recent news reports about Iran and Russia trying to undermine our election highlight the need for election security. The House has passed three bills to secure our elections including the Shield Act passed one year ago today. Yet all three are being blocked in the GOP Senate. https://t.co/z1JBZkhxCO
Glad I was able to join! https://t.co/UBcRp35ujG

Because of President Trump's failure to address this pandemic more than 6 million Americans have filed for food assistance. A federal judge rightly blocked him from trying to strip these benefits and make it harder for families to put food on the table. https://t.co/H5ebx0L07t

Today begins Medicare open enrollment! President Trump's SCOTUS nominee refused to say whether Social Security & Medicare are constitutional. 65 million Americans depend on Medicare for their healthcare. As you shop plans remember #WhatsAtStake  https://t.co/Jqv35pj4Qf

The Supreme Court is allowing the Trump Administration to end the census count early risking an accurate count. But you can still be counted. The final day is TOMORROW October 15. Visit https://t.co/uoWFrhYFcU and be counted! https://t.co/wNRWviCg1t

Be aware that unofficial ballot drop boxes were found in CA. There are many safe ways to return ballots-by mail in person at a voting location or official ballot drop boxes. Find an official ballot drop-off location near you: https://t.co/wYDhnQOdoU  https://t.co/YX9fCX4y88

I'm honored to receive a perfect score on the @HRC Congressional Scorecard. We must continue to fight for LGBTQ rights to ensure complete equality. #HRCscorecard  https://t.co/DMjVVtQNm4 https://t.co/L67mqShh4E

.@RepMikeLevin and I just introduced legislation to enroll eligible military children in school meals programs. Too many military families are struggling to put food on the table. Of all the sacrifices they make this shouldn't be one of them. https://t.co/XtdbeU6Wzd

People are struggling to survive and the Senate continues its "wait and see" attitude toward providing families relief. The House passed an updated #HeroesAct to meet the GOP halfway. They need to come back to the negotiating table so we can get this done. https://t.co/zl2LejQuyH

The House passed an updated #HeroesAct to meet Republicans halfway to address the health and economic catastrophe in our country. I hope they will finally negotiate and help us pass a bill that protects our heroes crushes the coronavirus and puts money in people’s pockets.
Wishing the President and First Lady a speedy recovery. I hope he will gain empathy for the millions of Americans suffering through this pandemic and treat it as the threat it truly is.
So honored to be at the ceremony for the first woman to lie in State - the first Jewish woman as well. To all of RBG's firsts. https://t.co/L4F6sbKj4k

Proud to help pass the #CleanEconomyJobs and Innovation Act to spur clean energy innovation electrify our transportation sector and make homes and businesses more energy efficient. We must begin to #ActOnClimate. https://t.co/sZI28OaV21

Ed & Labor Comm passed my bill to expand apprenticeships and invest in our workforce. When so many workers have been forced to look for new pathways to financial stability Congress must to do all it can to create opportunities for meaningful work and family-supporting wages. https://t.co/PsvKGEIjTa

It has been 575 days since the House passed universal background checks (HR 8). Already this year more than 12000 have died from gun violence. Today we #WearOrangeMasks to demand that Leader McConnell allow the Senate to vote on this bipartisan bill. https://t.co/IrVL5i8OvE

There is still time to complete the #2020Census! By answering a few simple questions you are contributing to the future of our community. Get counted today at https://t.co/anO6MSe0lk https://t.co/IjeUBNjHkZ

Shortly the House Ed & Labor Comm will consider my legislation to expand apprenticeships & invest in workforce training. As we face record-level unemployment due to COVID-19 my bill will help raise employment rates and promote our economic recovery. https://t.co/0yWZPOsr9C

Proud of my A rating from @ActForParks when it comes to protecting our National Parks. They are national treasures that we must protect for current and future generations! #ActForParks https://t.co/D1uAppuhWS

Paid my respects to Justice Ginsburg last night at the Supreme Court and you can see the outpouring of love for such an iconic and legendary legal mind. While there is no replacing her we should honor her last wishes and wait until a new President is installed. https://t.co/UdxjTS1wzf
What a loss. Condolences to her family and all those who helped her “spirit soar.” Love to you RBG.

Like so many-it feels personal and not real.  She has surmounted so many health issues to contribute and serve her country. Absence her championing the rights of women for liberty and justice for all we would not be where we are. https://t.co/kYxLWExsSL

To all those who celebrate I am wishing you a Shanah Tova U’metukah. In this time of continued uncertainty may the year 5781 begin with blessings. May the new year be one filled with sweetness and most importantly good health for everyone. https://t.co/91aRCL9joC
House Democrats are working #ForThePeople https://t.co/lBBX7GA0Ry
During #SuicidePreventionMonth let’s work to break down barriers to mental health support. The National Suicide Prevention Lifeline is available 24/7 in both English and Spanish at (800) 273-8255.

No one should have to choose between their health & their right to vote. We need no-excuse vote by mail across the nation. My Universal Right to Vote by Mail Act is in the #HeroesAct which will protect Americans financially and their vote. #ForThePeople https://t.co/dxhCPQwz7v

Joined my House colleagues in strongly denouncing  anti-Asian discrimination which has seen a dramatic increase during the COVID-19 pandemic. Racism discrimination and intolerance have no place in America. https://t.co/pYRXvzxyjr

The Pregnant Workers Fairness Act will benefit all pregnant workers—but especially the more than 1 in 5 pregnant women who work in a low-paying jobs where the work is likely to be physically demanding and lack flexibility. #protectpregnantworkers #pwfa https://t.co/mzQuwcA2Of

I unveiled the National Apprenticeship Act to build on the success of our apprenticeship programs. It streamlines standards accountability coordinates with high school & higher ed institutions while providing a greater investment to increase access. https://t.co/Cffl1MJj9z

As a longtime advocate for diversity in education I was proud to help pass the Strength In Diversity Act today. This bill will increase racial and socioeconomic diversity in our nation’s schools by providing federal funding to support local efforts to increase diversity. https://t.co/2WR5Ij11k0

The details of the whistleblower's allegations are appalling and the DHS Inspector General needs to open an immediate investigation. Congress and the American people deserve answers. This is a latest example why we need to put an end to private prisons. https://t.co/9hUlYuHe7Q

Today marks the beginning of Hispanic Heritage Month. This month we honor Latinx and Hispanic Americans’ contributions to our nation. Amidst the COVID-19 pandemic Latinx are proving themselves more essential than ever and resilient in the face of adversity. #HHM https://t.co/SqGEgdhaIs

We can’t wait any longer for bold climate action. We are facing a #climatecrisis. The #GreenNewDeal will reduce greenhouse emissions bring us cleaner air and water and improve environmental sustainability—now more than ever we must pass this life-saving legislation. https://t.co/Eg0TUE0dal

More than anything  I mourned the loss to families and our first responders who confronted these heinous acts.  Thank you to all those who have sacrificed so much many for a lifetime of disabilities.#NeverForget
This day always shakes me personally with the memories of being in my Capitol office and having children living in New York.  It also sharpened my sense of responsibility to you my constituents.

Join me & @VetAffairsDems to reduce veteran suicide. During #SuicidePreventionWeek let veterans in crisis know help is available.  Veterans Crisis Line can be reached 24/7 by: •Calling 1-800-273-8255 & pressing 1 •Visiting https://t.co/ugAdy0ZN1b •Texting 838255
President Trump's betrayal of the American people is astounding. Just when our country needed leadership the most he purposely abdicated that responsibility. https://t.co/IlgDXBF9yP

On this #LaborDay let's recognize the health care workers on the frontlines caring for our loved ones as well as other essential workers and all workers. They have performed heroically and we should treat them accordingly. https://t.co/LeRWBOMR0z

Moved to see my veteran colleagues push back on Trump with words he's said publicly in the past. As someone honored to visit our men & women serving in war theaters over 20 yrs it's abhorrent that he's so disconnected from the trust put in him as President & Commander-in-Chief.
You your loved ones and your community all matter. Shape the future of your community by completing the Census today! Go to https://t.co/wNRWviCg1t to learn how to respond.

Honored to be recognized by SDMAC for my work on defense issues. I've always been proud to prioritize our servicemembers and their families in my role on the House Armed Services Committee. https://t.co/pyrIO25v0I

President Trump’s reckless approach to reopening schools endangers our children teachers and families. I'm holding a press conference right now calling on the Administration and Senate to fully fund our schools throughout this pandemic. WATCH: https://t.co/vek74SfF2C

The first week of school has begun in San Diego. As you know students are returning to classes online due to the pandemic. I want to know more about your thoughts on distance learning. Please take my survey below.  https://t.co/n96iWHjwhr

Families have lost loved ones and livelihoods are threatened. Despite the uncertainties we could always count on the efficiency of the Postal Service. House just voted to prevent Trump from sabotaging the USPS and our right to vote. #DontMessWithUSPS  https://t.co/7TbQ4Fs4aj
The San Diego Congressional delegation stands by our Postal workers and your right to have your voices heard. #DontMessWithUSPS  https://t.co/0atMREW6ru
The Mission Valley Stadium site is officially a part of the @SDSU campus. Sometimes dreams do come true! Congratulations to all who made it happen. https://t.co/IijYgzfwea
His abuse of power knows no bounds. I will continue to push for funds the USPS needs to do its job for the American people. #DontMessWithUSPS

President Trump’s assault on the USPS has a singular goal of serving himself. His attempt to rig the election in his favor jeopardizes the delivery of medicines paychecks and other vital mail that millions of Americans rely upon. #DontMessWithUSPS  https://t.co/t3vpmLuS9q
From the UAE and Israel comes good news.  Let’s hope this important step evolves into a milestone for peace in the region. https://t.co/uTnQK4ZbOs

Along with delivering mail ballots the Postal Service is responsible for delivering medicines paychecks and IRS refunds to millions of Americans. I joined 174 of my colleagues calling for the Postmaster General to reverse his policies that have worsened the crisis at the USPS. https://t.co/0OncN0Z3eR
There's a better way as the Cares Act demonstrated. Safety and support are needed. It is unconscionable to play with the livelihoods of the American people.

After a round of golf at his luxury golf club the President signed an executive order and three memos to say he was looking out for people but the relief will be sparse if at all. His action also threatens Social Security and Medicare.

As the pandemic continues to disrupt the lives of American families we must do all we can to ensure students can continue to learn free of the pain indignity and distraction of hunger. I'm leading a letter to ensure our schools can continue to feed children during the pandemic. https://t.co/BgHuak5vUB

55 years ago today the #VotingRightsAct was signed into law. However opponents of voting rights continue to suppress the vote and disenfranchise voters. Let's honor Rep. John Lewis by strengthening the VRA. #RestoreTheVRA #ForThePeople https://t.co/C7AHuW4jFn

As I'm fighting in Congress to help renters survive the pandemic the San Diego Housing Commission might be able to help you. Click below for more information on their rental assistance program. Their application deadline is Friday August 7. https://t.co/TdNqeo1YIm

My heartfelt condolences to the families of these Marines and sailor. We owe the families answers on how this happened. As a member of the House Armed Services Committee I will be following the Navy's investigation closely. https://t.co/JDeTvknl3b

The President is allowed to vote by mail which is secure and safe but doesn't want other Americans to have this right.  Also the election is going to happen on November 3rd whether he likes it or not.

Congratulations to @NASA for its successful launch of @NASAPersevere!  I know that this mission will yield many exciting discoveries and inspire countless generations of scientists stargazers and would-be astronauts for years to come.  https://t.co/uzfCZ2Sp84

The Commission on the Social Status of Black Men and Boys will examine how racism and social injustices create heavy mental and emotional burdens for black men and boys. With my strong support the House overwhelmingly passed the #BlackMenAndBoysAct https://t.co/nJ2QKfg6rz

The Latino story is an American story. There are so many lost histories heroes and memories of Latinos in our nation's past. I'm proud to support legislation to establish a #LatinoMuseum on our National Mall which passed the House today! https://t.co/wTCof2vzzx

If only there was a bill already passed by the House the Senate could act on. Wait there was. #HeroesAct was passed more than two months ago. It extends unemployment benefits helps renters homeowners cities and states small businesses and schools. https://t.co/qozRqPdpr9

The comments and misogyny directed toward my colleague Rep. Ocasio-Cortez are disgusting. Her heartfelt and eloquent remarks on the importance of treating one another with decency and respect are worth watching and applying in everyday conduct. https://t.co/oVxWu9g19N

We have responsibility to protect open spaces for future generations. The House passed with my support to fully fund the Land and Water Conservation Fund and establish the National Parks and Public Land Legacy Restoration Fund. https://t.co/vkOkTJviSg

Every year I’ve been in Congress I asked John Lewis to speak to San Diego high school seniors who visited our Capitol as part of an in-depth civics program. And for 20 years he would give his time energy and wisdom to graciously answer their spirited questions. https://t.co/Q6S1bRZzKF

The United States has always been and must continue to be a place that welcomes and embraces people of all religions and nationalities. I proudly voted to repeal President Trump's muslim ban.  #NoBanAct https://t.co/0c0Bmtxz6P

The statues in the U.S. Capitol Building should represent the values of America. I voted to remove statues honoring those individuals who served in the Confederacy and supported racism slavery and segregation. #RemoveHate https://t.co/RiG3cg5Aqy

John Lewis's legacy encompasses so many things but nothing more so than voting. In September 2018 he spoke to the students at Morse High School in San Diego about the importance of taking part in our democracy. He always had time to show his support for our young people. https://t.co/NeTpXAbuls
He had a special relationship with many of our high school students who visited our Capitol.  He always responded when they asked for his time and story. https://t.co/eMyJw7EiwA

What a  loss to all who felt his courage and greatness as he urged us to make “good trouble.” I am both profoundly saddened and grateful to have spent work days and pilgrimages with him as he led us through the fight for civil rights for all. #goodtrouble https://t.co/EGhh2jj1W8
This is alarming. The president should not be weaponizing federal agents against the American people for exercising their First Amendment right. https://t.co/9VJYaWC8Re

Unemployment benefits run out at the end of the month. House passed #HeroesAct TWO MONTHS ago which would extend benefits through January. Solution is simple Leader McConnell do your job & let the Senate vote to pass the Heroes Act. American families have waited long enough.
Pleased to see the Administration reversing its plan to deport foreign students if their colleges move to online courses. My House colleagues and I called for this last week. https://t.co/eH8pdt7xbD
Glad to know there were no serious injuries and all are accounted for. https://t.co/tMlLjZSYGv
Excellent conversation today with the @SDChamber and my colleagues @RepScottPeters @RepJuanVargas and @RepMikeLevin on issues important to San Diego and the nation. https://t.co/8ThVVMZ3rA

Led a letter calling on Trump Admin to reverse its decision to deport foreign students if coursework moves online. We all want courses to be in the classroom but safety is paramount. The admin needs to look for solutions not contribute to the problem. https://t.co/eKc09sOKmL
It’s been TWO WEEKS since @HouseDemocrats passed the George Floyd #JusiticeInPolicing Act. Now it’s time for the Senate to do their job and hold a vote. https://t.co/lDMEo9DAva

This ruling is a blow to inclusive accessible health care & reproductive freedom. I'm cosponsoring the Protect Access to Birth Control Act. Birth control is health care–Americans’ health coverage options shouldn't be at the discretion of their employers. https://t.co/QzjqsrXM7O

Despite the policies put in place to end sexual misconduct in the military the system failed Vanessa. It's sad and infuriating. As a member of the Armed Services Committee I’ll be demanding answers. We owe it to Vanessa her family and those serving. https://t.co/0qWurwIFUs

Social distancing in the larger Ways and Means Committee room for the National Defense Authorization markup instead of our usual Armed Services committee room. Looking forward to passing my amendment to address military hunger. https://t.co/HXpgxg6Fta
A victory for women's health. Let's pass the Women's Health Protection Act which I am cosponsoring to protect the abortion rights of every woman no matter where she lives. https://t.co/BxMLB2Jlar

I just voted to make DC the 51st state in our Union and give equal representation to 700000 American citizens. This historic legislation will grant DC residents the same protections and representation as their fellow citizens. We need #DCStatehood now! https://t.co/VpKTtGWmUU

Congress voted to block Secretary DeVos’s latest plan to prioritize profits for predatory schools over defrauded student borrowers. But President Trump's veto allows DeVos to carry out her plan. Today the House is voting to overturn the presidential veto and #StandWithStudents. https://t.co/wYAe43ME0N
This moment begs us to act -- to be bold -- to capture opportunity for change. Let's bring justice to those who lost their lives from police brutality. #JusticeinPolicing https://t.co/A5lUiqJOeT

Today the House will take transformative action on policing and justice reform. We have seen too many lives taken and communities devastated by police brutality and racial profiling. Action is long overdue. #JusticeInPolicing https://t.co/Gla9NdWbyq
The GOP Senate bill simply does not meet the moment we are in. We need bold police reform which the House will vote on this week. https://t.co/4fGBc24xDk

As we struggle through this crisis in the fight for freedom and justice #Juneteenth takes on extra meaning. Despite the pain we are feeling in this moment Juneteenth is a ray of hope symbolizing that things will get better. https://t.co/pZczZHmIQt

Calling all High Schoolers and Middle Schoolers in CA-53! Are you looking for something fun and challenging to do over summer break? Registration is open for the 2020 Congressional App Challenge. Visit https://t.co/pVRcgJaBhn for more information and to sign-up.

This is a massive victory for #equality freedom and the values on which our nation was founded. No one should lose their job based on who they are or who they love. #LGBT #LGBTQ  https://t.co/TLpqHnJ1bE

The American people deserve to know that their tax dollars were used as intended. The Administration needs to reverse this decision and come clean. https://t.co/QHySZhrgAr

These reforms are long overdue. They also need to be accompanied by significant investments that achieve social economic and environmental justice in our communities.”
Creates a National Police Misconduct Registry to prevent problematic officers who are fired or leave an agency from moving to another jurisdiction without accountability.

Removes barriers to prosecuting police misconduct and recovering damages. Reforms qualified immunity to hold officers accountable who violate a person’s civil rights.  Makes lynching a federal hate crime.

Bans chokeholds carotid holds and no-knock warrants in drug cases at the federal level and incentivizes state and local governments to do the same.  De-militarizes the police by limiting the transfer of military weaponry to state and local police.

Prohibits federal state and local law enforcement from racial religious and discriminatory profiling. Requires training on racial religious and discriminatory profiling for all law enforcement.  Increases transparency by requiring dashboard and body cameras.

Today is National Gun Violence Awareness Day and I'm showing my commitment to gun violence prevention. Every year nearly 38000 people are killed by gunfire in the United States. We've passed legislation in the House I'm demanding the Senate do the same. #WearOrange https://t.co/WMSqEnet8b

Seeing the level of military and law enforcement personnel throughout our nation's capital is chilling enough. That they are without identifying insignias badges or name plates is even more so and not what America is about. The people deserve answers from the President. https://t.co/EPBxfzOTNe

Every American should read these pieces by former Defense Secretary Mattis & Joints Chief Chair Admiral Mullen. They're striking condemnations of President Trump’s failure to lead America at this sad time. General Mattis: https://t.co/pepOrZc5VR

Feel your power! Your voices have been heard with new charges in the murder of George Floyd. But the work is not done as we march toward real justice and social reform and an end to police brutality. https://t.co/ZRBVr1OSmZ

Using tear gas to clear out peaceful protesters for a photo op shows what Trump is truly made of-narcissistic acts instead of bringing the country together. As Americans look for compassion understanding & leadership he's engaging in & encouraging acts of violence against them.
We must listen to these cries learn from the pain and focus our energy on making a real change possible.

What we witnessed over the weekend was a cry for change a result of repeated trauma. The many tragedies we've witnessed are a constant reminder that we have deep-seated systemic problems that hurt many in our communities and put a stain on our sense of justice.

La Mesa came together today after last night. Many were peacefully protesting yesterday as people are doing across our country. As communities continue to demonstrate for justice for George we can’t let the acts of a few distract from the focus of long overdue action and change.
Grateful to those who never stop dreaming and shooting for the stars.  #LaunchAmerica @NASA

For a President of the United States of America to threaten violence against the American People is beyond outrageous. It's clear Trump lacks any moral authority to be a leader America needs. https://t.co/ayuMcnUl6Q

Saddened about a most regretful history that doesn’t take a break. What happened to George Floyd was a crime and while the firing of the officers involved was correct charges should be brought. This kind of violence must stop. There must be #JusticeForGeorgeFloyd & his family.

Sadly and solemnly we acknowledge the passing of over 100000 victims of COVID-19. To their families and loving persons who weren’t able to be by their side we reach out with virtual hugs and support. https://t.co/ALSA7mDyLY

This #OlderAmericansMonth we celebrate the contributions seniors have made in our families and communities. As we continue to confront the #COVID19 pandemic we must ensure they have the support they need. https://t.co/0cVeaGALda
Those we lost protecting us and defending our freedom will live on in our hearts forever. #MemorialDay https://t.co/bzMxbUJmAj

Anthony & Elizabeth Cady Stanton who for 50 years led the movement for the vote & women's rights never got to exercise that right. President Trump threatens battleground states for sending voters #VoteByMail applications but not red states doing the same thing. I wonder why. 🤔 https://t.co/PyP31qbHnq
